meanings.definition: Agreement in opinion or sentiment; the act of agreeing.
meanings.sent1: The concurrence of their ideas led to a successful project.
meanings.sent2: The concurrence of their thoughts made the decision easy.
meanings.sent3: Their concurrence on the movie choice made for a fun evening.
meanings.sent4: The concurrence of their laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The concurrence of their voices created a harmonious melody.

meanings.definition: The simultaneous occurrence of events or circumstances.
meanings.sent1: The concurrence of the thunder and lightning startled everyone.
meanings.sent2: The concurrence of the traffic jam and heavy rain caused delays.
meanings.sent3: The concurrence of the dog barking and the doorbell ringing was chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The concurrence of the waves crashing and seagulls squawking was peaceful.
meanings.sent5: The concurrence of the fireworks and music made for a festive atmosphere.
